meanings.definition: The state of being without money; penniless.
meanings.sent1: Her impecuniousness prevented her from buying even the smallest luxuries.
meanings.sent2: His impecuniousness led him to seek financial assistance from his family.
meanings.sent3: Despite his impecuniousness, he always had a smile on his face.
meanings.sent4: The weight of impecuniousness felt like a heavy burden on her shoulders.
meanings.sent5: The stark reality of impecuniousness hit him hard when he couldn't afford basic necessities.

meanings.definition: The quality or state of being impecunious.
meanings.sent1: The impecuniousness of the situation was evident in their threadbare clothes.
meanings.sent2: She tried to hide her impecuniousness by avoiding social gatherings.
meanings.sent3: His impecuniousness was so extreme that he started a 'broke college student' club.
meanings.sent4: The impecuniousness of the town was reflected in its crumbling infrastructure.
meanings.sent5: The stark reality of impecuniousness hit him hard when he couldn't afford basic necessities.
